questions.text: With reference to mammography, which one of the following statements correct?

options.label: A
options.text: A baseline study be done for all women at age 30

options.label: B
options.text: It uses less radiation energy than a chest X-ray

options.label: C
options.text: It should be part of the regular follow up of a woman following therapy for unilateral breast cancer

options.label: D
options.text: It provides an effective substitute for biopsy of suspicious lesions

questions.correct_answer: C. It should be part of the regular follow up of a woman following therapy for unilateral breast cancer

questions.text: The correct procedure of inserting the following equipment in the image given below:
Patient presents to emergency department with open pneumothorax, the next line of management?

options.label: C
options.text: Occlusive dressing with taping on the 3 sides

options.label: D
options.text: Closure of the chest defect with conservative management

questions.correct_answer: C. Occlusive dressing with taping on the 3 sides

questions.text: All except are true for the image Shown?

options.label: B
options.text: Occlusion of portal triad at foramen of winslow

options.label: C
options.text: Controls bleeding from hepatic artery; poratal vein and hepatic vein

questions.correct_answer: C. Controls bleeding from hepatic artery; poratal vein and hepatic vein

questions.text: A 17-year-old boy is admitted to the hospital after a road traffic injury. Per abdomen examination is normal. After adequate resuscitation, his pulse rate is 80/min and BP is 110/70. Abdominal CT reveals 1 cm deep laceration in the left lobe of the liver extending from the dome more than half way through the parenchyma. Appropriate management at this time would be

options.label: B
options.text: Abdominal exploration and packing of hepatic wounds

options.label: C
options.text: Abdominal exploration and ligation of left hepatic artery

questions.text: A 22 year old boy meets with a RTA and is rushed to the ER, where the doctor notices that the patient has fractured his left lower ribs. Patient has a pulse rate of 78/min and his BP is 110/80mm Hg. He is complaining of pain in his abdomen and is guarding his left upper abdomen. Which is the investigation of choice in this patient?
All except are true regarding Pheochromocytoma?

options.label: A
options.text: Urine 24 hr metanephrines is biochemical IOC

options.label: C
options.text: Preoperative adequate Beta blockade followed by alpha blockade is required

options.label: D
options.text: Laparoscopic adrenelectomy is the standard of care.

questions.correct_answer: C. Preoperative adequate Beta blockade followed by alpha blockade is required

questions.text: Preferred age for prophylactic thyroidectomy in a patient with family history of MEN 2 B and gene mutation positive.

A 30-year-old male undergoes a right superficial parotidectomy. Eight months later he presents to the outpatient department complaining of flushing and sweating of the right side of his face on eating. On starch iodine test following image is seen He is diagnosed as having Frey’s syndrome and is listed for botulinum toxin injections. Misdirected re-innervation of which nerve is responsible for this syndrome?

A 30-year-old man is involved in a road traffic accident. He presents to the Emergency Department appearing mildly anxious, after losing a signifi cant amount of blood, with tachycardia (113/min), tachypnoea (25/min) and oliguria (20 mL/hour). Which of the following statements is true about his degree of hypovolaemic shock?

A 45-year-old lady is awaiting a mastectomy and axillary node clearance for a central, invasive breast tumour. After careful consideration, the surgeon decides to excise the level I and level II nodes during the procedure. Which of the following structures best defines the level of axillary clearance?
Which of the following is least likely possibility in this condition, patient presents with nodule in right lobe of thyroid
Which of the following patients is considered an appropriate candidate for breast-preserving therapy with lumpectomy followed by radiation therapy?

options.label: A
options.text: A 40-year-old woman with a history of active scleroderma and a T1N0 infiltrating ductal carcinoma of her right breast

options.label: B
options.text: A 45-year-old woman with a T1N1 infiltrating ductal carcinoma of her left breast after lumpectomy, negative surgical margins, and axillary lymph node dissection with 2 of 12 lymph nodes positive

options.label: C
options.text: A 37-year-old woman with a T2N0 infiltrating ductal carcinoma of her right breast who has a history of Hodgkin disease treated with 36 Gy to a mantle field 15 years earlier

questions.correct_answer: B. A 45-year-old woman with a T1N1 infiltrating ductal carcinoma of her left breast after lumpectomy, negative surgical margins, and axillary lymph node dissection with 2 of 12 lymph nodes positive

questions.text: Which of the following statement is false about this condition

options.label: B
options.text: Grows outside the boundary of original scar

questions.text: A 14-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with a 4-h history of acute, severe left scrotal pain. Examination reveals a high-riding left testicle and scrotal exploration was done. Which of the following is true?

options.label: C
options.text: Detorsion and orchidopexy of the same side

options.label: D
options.text: Detorsion and orchidopexy of both sides

questions.correct_answer: D. Detorsion and orchidopexy of both sides

questions.text: Which statement is false regarding the picture shown below?

options.label: B
options.text: Mostly occurs spontaneously without any injury.

options.label: C
options.text: Retrograde urethrography should be uniformly performed to assess for urethral injury

options.label: D
options.text: Physical examination is usually sufficient in making the diagnosis or for deciding on surgical management

questions.correct_answer: D. Physical examination is usually sufficient in making the diagnosis or for deciding on surgical management

questions.text: False about the picture shown below?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a micturating cystourethrogram showing PUV

questions.correct_answer: D. More commonly seen in females

questions.text: A patient comes with colicky pain in left flank, Urine examination reveals the following picture. The picture is suggestive of which type of renal stone ?
False about the picture of renal stone shown below ?

options.label: D
options.text: These days open surgery is not preferred even for large stones

questions.text: False about this condition shown on IVP ?

options.label: B
options.text: More common on the right side

options.label: D
options.text: The upper pole ureter opens distal and medial in the bladder compared to the lower pole ureter.

questions.text: A 25 year old male presented with persistent back ache. Symptoms are aggravated by hyperextension. Coronal section of CT and IVP is given below. Which of the following is a false statement about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: This condition is more common in males

questions.text: A 24-year-old motorcyclist has a collision with a car and is thrown 2 metres, landing on his head. When assessed at the scene he is mumbling incoherently, moving in response to command and opening his eyes only in response to painful stimuli. His GCS score is:

A 74-year-old man is 1-day post-transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP) for benign prostatic hyperplasia. The nurse calls a doctor to review this gentleman as he is uncomfortable and in pain on the ward. There is nothing remarkable on general examination; however, on inspecting the catheter for potential blockage it is discovered that there is a tight constricting band just proximal to the glans penis, which is swollen and pale.(figure) What abnormality does this gentleman have?

A 78-year-old man presents to his GP with a swelling in his scrotum associated with a dragging sensation. His past medical history is remarkable for episodes of haematuria under investigation by the urologists and a recent admission to hospital 2 months ago complaining of flank pain with a course of antibiotics for a suspected pyelonephritis. On examination there is a mass in the left hemiscrotum that transmits a cough impulse and is described in the notes like a ‘bag of worms’(figure). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 21-year-old man is brought into the emergency department with penile pain and swelling following a fall onto the crossbar of a bicycle. On examination, the penis is oedematous and bruised and there is blood at the urethral meatus(figure), He is otherwise stable. Which of the following investigations is indicated?

A male infant presents with a swelling in his scrotum that has been present since birth. His mother states that the swelling changes in size when the infant cries and does not seem to be painful. On exam, the mass appears to be adjacent to his testicle which is palpated posteriorly. The mass is soft and non-tender and transilluminates.(figure) There is no bulge or mass at the internal ring. What is the most appropriate next step in the management?
Regarding the congenital anomalies of the thyroid, all of the following are correct except:

options.label: A
options.text: A lingual thyroid lies beneath the epithelium of the tongue, has higher risk of malignancy, and is supplied by lingual arteries.

options.label: B
options.text: Thyroglossal duct cysts are the most common midline congenital masses of the neck.

options.label: C
options.text: Lateral aberrant nodules containing thyroid tissue should be considered metastatic unless proven otherwise

options.label: D
options.text: Aspiration is the treatment of choice for thyroglossal duct cysts.

questions.correct_answer: D. Aspiration is the treatment of choice for thyroglossal duct cysts.

questions.text: Which is not a component of revised trauma score?
All of the following are correct, in a radical neck dissection, except:

options.label: A
options.text: The internal jugular vein is sacrificed.

options.label: B
options.text: The deep cervical fascia must be excised.

questions.correct_answer: D. The vagus nerve is sacrificed.

questions.text: All of the following are correct regarding the image shown below except

options.label: A
options.text: Cystic hygromas represent a cystic dilatation of the lymphatic vessels.

options.label: B
options.text: Cystic hygromas fail to drain the lymph into the venous circulations.

options.label: C
options.text: Cystic hygromas are most common in the posterior neck region.

options.label: D
options.text: Cystic hygromas require radical excision with at least 1 cm margins.

questions.correct_answer: D. Cystic hygromas require radical excision with at least 1 cm margins.

questions.text: A 35-year-old-man is brought to the Emergency Department following a road traffic accident. He demonstrates signs and symptoms of a simple pneumothorax, which is confirmed on chest radiography. Which of the following anatomical landmarks is not useful for delineating the 'safe triangle' for chest drain insertion in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Anterior border of the latissimus dorsi

questions.text: A 55-year-old lady with polymyalgia rheumatica is brought to the Emergency Department by ambulance for sudden onset chest pain, which started while she was driving. The pain was described as being 'ripping' in nature and radiated to her back and jaw. Her pulse rate is 110/min, and blood pressure from her right and left arms are 142/70 mmHg and 167/82 mmHg respectively. A portable CXR reveals a widened mediastinum and a small pleural effusion. What is the most likely diagnosis?

You are consulted on a 35 year-old male, who otherwise healthy, was initially admitted 26 days ago in septic shock secondary to a necrotizing soft tissue infection of the right lower extremity. He required high-dose vasopressors for several days following emergent operative debridement and institution of broad-spectrum antibiotics. He was recovering well in the ICU and was recently extubated. However he developed tachycardia, fever, and leukocytosis. The ICU team calls you to evaluate because they are unable to identify a source of infection. You examine his back and find a pressure sore overlying the right ischial tuberosity approximately 4 × 5 cm in size with a black eschar overlying, expressible malodorous fluid, and surrounding cellulitis. What is the stage of this pressure ulcer?

Surgeons are required to possess a good working knowledge of the various types of suture needles and their utility in various surgical procedures. Which one of the following descriptions of needle type is most appropriate for the corresponding surgical procedure?

options.label: A
options.text: Blunt round-point needle for tendon repair

options.label: C
options.text: Reverse cutting needle for mass closure of the abdominal wall

questions.correct_answer: D. Round-bodied needle for bowel anastomosis

questions.text: A 30-year-old man is involved in a road traffic accident and is brought to the Emergency Department complaining of abdominal and back pain. He has no other overt injuries but has left loin and left upper quadrant tenderness on abdominal examination. He undergoes a CT scan of his abdomen which shows a normal spleen but a 3-cm renal laceration with a perinephric haematoma. How would you classify this injury on the basis of the American Association for Surgery of trauma classification of renal injuries?

A 65-year-old male with Crohn’s disease presents with a high output enterocutaneous fistula. He is started on total parenteral nutrition (TPN) to decrease the fistula output and improve his general nutritional status. Which of the following statements are false regarding TPN?

options.label: A
options.text: It may cause fatty liver when used over a long period

options.label: B
options.text: It increases the risk of acalculous cholecystitis

options.label: C
options.text: It may result in metabolic complications such a refeeding syndrome, resulting in hyperkalaemia, hypermagnesaemia, and hyperphosphataemia

options.label: D
options.text: Sepsis due to fungal infections is especially common in patients receiving TPN

questions.correct_answer: C. It may result in metabolic complications such a refeeding syndrome, resulting in hyperkalaemia, hypermagnesaemia, and hyperphosphataemia

questions.text: Patient suffers a severe trauma in a road accident. Which should be done first?

A 50-year-old male presents to your office with a skin lesion on the face concerning or a melanoma. Biopsy determines a superficial spreading melanoma with a depth of 1.1 mm. What is the next step in the management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

options.label: B
options.text: High dose interferon alpha 2b is recommended

options.label: D
options.text: Excisional biopsy and a total parotidectomy

questions.correct_answer: A. Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

questions.text: A 37-year-old woman presents with a right anterior neck mass. She denies dysphagia or hoarseness. There is no history of radiation exposure or family history of cancer, and no palpable nodes are detected on physical examination. Neck ultrasound reveals a 2.5-cm right thyroid solid nodule without enlarged cervical lymph nodes. Fine-needle aspiration (FNA) suggests the diagnosis of papillary thyroid carcinoma. You recommend which one of the following as the initial management plan?

options.label: C
options.text: Total thyroidectomy with modified right neck dissection

options.label: D
options.text: Total thyroidectomy with bilateral neck dissection

questions.text: After a RTA NCCT Head was done. All are true about this condition except

options.label: A
options.text: Secondary injury is worse than primary injury

options.label: C
options.text: Classical injury is the impact on the parietal bone.

options.label: D
options.text: Require immediate transfer to the neurological facility

questions.correct_answer: C. Classical injury is the impact on the parietal bone.
